xml.brief: Retrieve log entries of a specified user

desc.p: Retrieve log entries of a specified user.

req.name: user_uuid
req.p: ID of the user. (Use services/users/by_username to get it.)

opt.name: limit
opt.p: Integer N. If given, no more than N logs will be returned (the most recent ones). Maximum allowed value is 1000.
Note: Some users have thousands of log entries!

opt.name: offset
opt.p: Combined with the limit argument, this gives you an abbility to get all log entries of the user (with multiple requests).

returns.p: A list of log entries, ordered by descending date. Each entry is a dictionary of the following format:

ul.li: uuid - ID of the log entry,

li.p: date - date and time (ISO 8601) when the log entry was submitted.

Please note that log entries often contain dates only (with the times truncated to midnight, as in the local timezone). In such cases, you may want to avoid displaying the time. You may assume that if the date value contains the "00:00:00" string, then it is date-only.
type - string; log type. This could be pretty much everything, but there are some primary types (see logs/entry method for more info).

ul.li: comment - HTML string, text entered with the log entry.
